meanings.definition: A person who makes something real or brings something into existence.
meanings.sent1: The realisers of the plan worked hard to turn their idea into a successful project.
meanings.sent2: The team of realisers brought the dream of a new playground to life for the children in the community.
meanings.sent3: The realisers of the surprise party had to be very sneaky to keep it a secret from the birthday girl.
meanings.sent4: The realisers of the peace treaty were hailed as heroes for their efforts in ending the conflict.
meanings.sent5: The realisers of the invention faced many challenges but never gave up on their goal.

meanings.definition: A group of people who understand or become aware of something.
meanings.sent1: The realisers of the situation quickly grasped the severity of the problem.
meanings.sent2: The realisers in the meeting shared their insights and perspectives on the issue at hand.
meanings.sent3: The realisers of the joke burst into laughter as they finally understood the punchline.
meanings.sent4: The realisers of the mystery were able to piece together the clues and solve the case.
meanings.sent5: The realisers of the concept were excited to delve deeper into its implications and applications.

meanings.definition: The act of achieving or completing something.
meanings.sent1: The realisers of the marathon felt a sense of accomplishment as they crossed the finish line.
meanings.sent2: The realisers of the project celebrated their success with a well-deserved party.
meanings.sent3: The realisers of the challenge were proud of their perseverance and determination.
meanings.sent4: The realisers of the goal knew that hard work and dedication had led them to victory.
meanings.sent5: The realisers of the mission were commended for their dedication and commitment to the cause.
